content.description: Start standing at the right side of the boulder's south face and use good holds to haul your body upwards towards the summit.  The hueco on top contains some major leaf litter so use caution to avoid a mishap. Starting lower on the corner (look for the fantastic hidden undercling) adds two fun moves and is about V1.
content.location: Located in "The Alcove" on Ely Mtn. on the southern side of the southernmost boulder in the group of four.

content.description:
Stand start using any combination of holds that work: sidepull, arete pinch, some funky slopers that face the wrong direction, a high undercling...thought provoking and some cool huecos on top.

The route to the left is called Shrieking Eels and is about V1. The lower portion is alright but the top out is fun.  There's a rotten crimper up there though that shouldn't be trusted.
content.location:
At "The Alcove" area on Ely Mtn.

Please:

Treat the land with respect.

Take all of your personal stuff and trash with you when you leave.

Practice minimum impact and have fun.

Oh, and bee safe too!
